description:
Full Job Description
Position Overview
Magna’s ADAS technologies are shaping an autonomous future and improving lives.
The ADAS intern/Co-op supports the ADAS team by integrating, developing, testing and debugging the ADAS algorithms such as ACC, AEB, Lane Centering, Lane Keep Assist etc.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Develop building blocks for ADAS features/algorithms Integrate new or modified Simulink models into the MATLAB and/or CarMaker test environment Create or modify test cases based on the requirements to cover the new or modified functionalities Debug issues found and root cause them Report and document issues; Propose correction to issue reported Perform systems testing of products on bench and in vehicles making sure the product functions and performs as the customer expects per requirements.

Qualifications: Enrolled in a master’s or PhD degree program in Mechanical Engineering / Electrical Engineering / Automotive Engineering/ Computer Science or equivalent

Education / Experience
High School Diploma
Currently Attending a college or University

Special Knowledge / Skills: Experience in vehicle dynamics OR control systems OR digital signal processing through coursework or industry experience Coursework or project with vehicle simulation/testing Experience with Matlab/Simulink and Stateflow MS Office Tools knowledge Basic knowledge of ADAS features Working knowledge in structured engineering approach troubleshooting and debugging skills Experience with CarMaker/CarSim/Requivalent software Experience in ADAS/AD academic/industry projects Execution of test suites in a model/software in the loop environment (MIL/SIL) Working knowledge in development of portable, reusable and modular software in automotive environment.

Physical Demands / Work Environment: Normal amount of sitting or standing, average mobility to move around an office environment, able to conduct normal amount of work at a computer.
Role Summary
Assist team in planning, coordinating, and executing engineering projects. Key Responsibilities Support with Engineering changes. Work with design team to create / modify CAD models. Assist with engineering documentation (DFMEA’s & DVP’s). Help facilitate critical design reviews. Assist with updates to design rules and specifications. Assist Lead Engineers with current production program support. Assist (PTS) product technical specialists. Key Qualifications/Requirements Some related experience preferred but not required. Able to work 30-40 hours a week. High School Diploma
Currently Attending a College or University
Degree’s towards Electrical, Software, Mechanical and Systems engineering preferred. Additional Information Proficient Computer knowledge and skills, Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Professional Communication skills (written and verbal) Strong technical and analytical competence in select areas of technology.

description:
Full Job Description

Our company client has one of the most economically influential platforms to launch in 2021. We're Looking for FullStack and Backend Engineers living in the New Jersey or New York area. Engineers looking to earn a full time executive position within 6-8 months AFTER interning (unpaid) under the Lead Backend Security Engineer for Spotify and Venmo/Paypal.

This is an economically sustainable on-demand platform, which was evaluated at $125 Million during Forbes Summit '2019. The platform had up to six offers up to $25 Million, PRE-revenue and Pre-Launch. It will be the first economically sustainable on-demand platform to generate up to seven streams
of income, and host up to seven markets that generate up to 900 Billion in revenue annually; profitable within a pandemic or recession.

Our Lead Engineer (Advisor) Credentials and Background:

  • NJIT Master's Degree, Data Science, 4.0
  • NJIT Bachelor Degree, Web & Information Systems, 3.89
  • Coursera: Verified Certificates (Computational Investing)
  • Udacity: NanoDegree, Deep Learning
  • The Data Incubator: Scholar, Deep Learning with BigDL
  • Chief Technical Advisor: Movement Vault
  • Platform Lead Backend Engineer: Venmo
  • Mentor: Techstars
  • Computer Science Teacher: Outco Inc.
  • Engineering: Spotify - Present
  • Raritan Valley College, Associate of Science, Web Developer, 3.56 Cum Laude

REQUIRED CREDENTIALS TO JOIN:

3-5 years of experience. Engineers (frontend or backend) MUST be fluent and experienced with using the following to build an APP; NO EXCEPTIONS: React Native (frontend) and Django (Backend), Github, AWS, and Slack. FrontEnd engineers must be fluent and experienced in React Native. Backend Engineers must be fluent and experienced in Django.

Engineers must also be experienced in 3 or more of the following:

  • Password encryption + salt
  • Backend server
  • Build token service for login and registration (open api)
  • Build and query database
  • The api gateway and amazon web services
  • JSON language (formats / sends data)
  • Java Script (backend) using node js
  • Writing in Unity engine + C sharp language
  • Backend security; Firewalls and encryption
  • Proficient in API Development
  • Jango
  • Python
  • PostgresQL
  • Developed and deployed app in app store

Minimum Requirement of 15-20 hrs a week.
Starting in September 2021.

This platform has a lot of backend data; geographic, gps, sales, and more.
Engineers can be in school or have a job currently. All engineers are guaranteed permanent positions with their desired position (salary to match position) once the app goes to market (scheduled) in Winter 2021; provided quality work and hours are met. There are currently 8 engineers on the team working remotely from various states, and 45 team members with advisors
who are managers at Ernst & Young (DC and NYC), Spotify, Venmo/Paypal, and Madison Square Garden.

We’re looking for applicants that take initiative and deliver on tasks (big and small) efficiently to move into positions of leadership quickly.

Legal action may be taken if an applicant provides false information for interview or orientation; this includes but is not limited to their current living location. This opportunity is not for remote learning or for engineers looking to relocate. Applicants must ALREADY be living distance of our preferred location/area of our business as cited.

  • Flexible schedule
  • Professional development assistance

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • On call
  • Weekend availability

Work Location:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

position: Intern - Solution Support Associate - Summer 2022, Virtual/ Work from Home
description:
Full Job Description
About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.

The Role

Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period (June 3, 2022 - August 12, 2022) our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.

Interns within the Strategic Enterprise and Public Sector Organization will be a part of an accelerated learning experience, to challenge skills learned in the classroom and develop new skills while working on active Lumen work projects. In this role, our goal is to provide our intern with a wide exposure to Lumen products and various organizations. He/She/They will work closely with the Solution Support Team to help off-load process related work from the SE Community. The objective is to free up SE time to drive complex Integrated Compute Solutions impacting Sales Performance.

The Experience

Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems
Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects
Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization.
Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.

The Main Responsibilities
Immersion Training/Education: technical on-boarding education track while shadowing lead engineers and learning the Lumen way.
Build proficiency in various tools required to perform successful research tasks and order submission.
Attend informal and formal presentations/trainings from technical specialist and sales peer audiences. Learn, learn, learn.
Customer Engagement: under supervision may attend customer meetings via collaboration tools and sometimes in person.
May work with technical teams in preparing proposal & presentation materials to include research, mock strategy discussions and solutions reviews.
Customer Success: support creation of solution design documentation and data capture processes during sales cycle

The ideal candidate is a self-starter, takes initiative, has a keen attention to detail, strong organization skills, communication skills, and maintains a professional demeanor.

Qualifications
Pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, or closely related field.
Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – June 2023.
3.0 or above cumulative GPA preferred
If position is in office, must have transportation to/from work daily
Must be available to work 30 – 40 hours, during the specified 10-week timeframe.
What to Expect Next

After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you!

Full Job Description

FLAGDream is an education technology corporation founded by an elite team from top tech companies in Silicon Valley. Our mission is to help students join the world's leading companies, relying on our strong resources, networks, and mentor teams throughout Silicon Valley and Wall Street. FLAGDream provides students with career development, consulting, and vocational skill training services. We cover industry trends such in computer science, AI, finance, management consulting, business analysis, FMCG/CPG, culture/creative industries, and more.

We are looking for a Recruiter with full-cycle recruiting experience, from talent sourcing and attracting candidates to interviewing and hiring great employees. A successful recruiter will collaborate with department managers on a regular basis and proactively identify future hiring needs. You should also be able to attract candidates using various sources, like social media networks and employee referrals. Our ideal recruiter holds an academic HR background combined with work experience in screening, interviewing and assessing candidates. Ultimately, the responsibilities of the Recruiter are to ensure our company attracts, hires and retains the best employees, while growing a strong talent pipeline.

Responsibilities

  • Design and implement overall recruiting strategy
  • Develop and update job descriptions and job specifications
  • Perform job and task analysis to document job requirements and objectives
  • Prepare recruitment materials and post jobs to appropriate job board/newspapers/colleges etc
  • Source and recruit candidates by using databases, social media etc
  • Screen candidates resumes and job applications
  • Conduct interviews using various reliable recruiting and selection tools/methods to filter candidates within schedule

  • Onboard new employees in order to become fully integrated
  • Provide analytical and well documented recruiting reports
  • Act as a point of contact and build influential candidate relationships during the selection process

Skills

Full Job Description
At NVIDIA, our employees are passionate about parallel and visual computing. We're united in our quest to transform the way graphics are used for work and play. Our technology impacts the visual experience in video game development, film production, space exploration, medicine, computational finance and automotive design. And we've only scratched the surface of what we can accomplish when we apply our technology to it.

We need passionate, hard-‐working and creative people to help us seek some of these unrivaled opportunities. The NVIDIA Deep Learning Institute (DLI) trains developers, data scientists and researchers how to tackle meaningful problems using artificial intelligence and accelerated computing. We are looking for an intern with an academic background not only in artificial intelligence (AI) or high performance computing (HPC) but also in an industry such as finance, automotive, healthcare, and cyber security. Additionally, students with experience in broader areas such as natural language processing (NLP) and conversational AI along with Education majors are encouraged to apply. Have other academic interests that can utilize AI / HPC - let us know! We would love to learn more.. In return, this role presents an opportunity for an intern to gain in-depth experience by working with other teams at NVIDIA that are in the same area of their academic pursuits.

What you'll be doing:
Research the application of AI and / or HPC in the context of your academic area of interest such as finance, cyber security, healthcare, automotive, etc.

Work with relevant teams within NVIDIA to further your understanding of the union of AI / HPC and your academic interests.

Author new project-based course content utilizing the latest interactive approaches to teaching.

Teach - deliver your finished work to both internal and external parties.

Propose new workshops and general direction on content.

What we need to see:
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Education, or an academic discipline with a solid understanding of AI / HPC concepts.

Familiarity with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.

Programming skills in a computer language such as Python, C / C++.

Experience using Jupyter notebooks, Google Colab, GitHub, and other related tools..

Interest in course development and interactive, virtual teaching techniques.

Positive relationship and interpersonal skills.

Ways to stand out in a crowd:
Ability to demonstrate your understanding of how AI / HPC can be applied in a meaningful way to another industry.

Passion for research.

Programming background.

AI school projects you can share are a plus!

NVIDIA has continuously reinvented itself over two decades. NVIDIA’s invention of the GPU in 1999 sparked the growth of the PC gaming market, redefined modern computer graphics, and revolutionized parallel computing. More recently, GPU deep learning ignited modern AI — the next era of computing — with the GPU acting as the brain of computers, robots, and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. This is our life’s work — to amplify human imagination and intelligence.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description

This job is a 100% remote, unpaid internship (with the option of college credit) giving industry experience to developers looking to advance their career by building high-quality decentralized products with a team in an Agile manner.

Minority Programmers Association is an international network of programmers and activists empowering underrepresented communities through STEM education, mentorship, job placement, and the development of socially impactful software solutions.

https://minorityprogrammers.org/

One of the biggest technologies that can empower minorities and those in developing nations is blockchain. In order to develop impactful blockchain projects, the Minority Programmers Association is proud to announce the creation of a Blockchain Project Management Intern position (unpaid).

We are seeking an energetic go-getter who is passionate about giving to the community and innovating through blockchain

This role will report to Lead Blockchain Engineer at Minority Programmers Association.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Collaborating with managers to determine blockchain technology needs and envisaged functionalities
  • Assist with the design, development and commercialization of blockchain products
  • Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
  • Develop a detailed project plan to monitor and track progress
  • Responsible for defining Go-To-Market strategy and product roadmaps
  • Guiding software product through various stages in lifecycle
  • Integrates market knowledge, strategic insight and a strong user focus to help our organization create great products
  • Work with designers and engineers to brainstorm application ideas on tools like Figma, Miro, Draw.io
  • Collaborating with the marketing team, and internal and external designers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user
  • Translate product strategy into detailed requirements for prototype construction and final product development by engineering teams
  • Research both MPA’s performance and the competitive landscape to find unserved needs and market opportunities
  • Reflect on data to analyze trends
  • Create test models to gauge user enjoyment and engagement
  • Develop strategic partnership for cross product integration

  • Perform risk management to minimize project risks
  • Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation
  • Exploration in blockchains like Solana, Casper, Cardano
  • Exploring the trenches of the decentralized finance space (DeFi), examining source code of different projects, forking, and expanding on their protocols

  • Working with SDKs to integrate other decentralized protocols in to dApps
  • Implementing DeFi functionality to dApps such as liquidity mining (yield farming), staking, lending, etc.
  • Optimizing and securing blockchain applications by integrating new tools and technologies
  • Applying the latest security techniques to protect digital transaction data against cyberattacks, information hacks, and rugpulling.
  • Develop spreadsheets, diagrams and process maps to document needs
  • Researching security audits and generating summaries
  • Research blockchain and cryptocurrency trends and investigate the field’s leading technology

  • Monday to Friday 9am-5pm (15-20 weekly hours) for at least a 3 month commitment

  • Available to work before or on October 1, 2021
  • Experience working with large codebases
  • Experience working with open-source projects
  • 1+ year experience in research
  • 1+ year experience in software development and programming
  • Knowledge of smart contracts, blockchain technology, ethereum compatible blockchains, decentralized finance
  • Experience with Git version control

  • Familiarity with P2P networks
  • Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Passion for blockchain technology and community

Full Job Description
Who We Are

Addepar's mission is to bring data, technology and people together to help investors make more informed and timely investment decisions. Our wealth management platform is transforming the fintech industry by providing data aggregation, analytics and reporting for even the most complex investment portfolios. Here, your voice matters. We believe that portfolio, market and client insights can make a significant and sustainable impact, one person and one community at a time. Working at the intersection of groundbreaking technology and limitless financial services industry growth, we are optimizing how capital is put to work.

Being a part of the AddeU Internship Program, you will be working on a meaningful project(s) that you can feel proud of and present back to the company at the end of the experience. In addition to having a supporting manager and mentor, we have a fantastic onboarding program to get you acclimated and ready for your time with us. Fun events and super cool swag are also included!

At the moment, our 12 week internship experience is remote. Dates are currently set for May - August, 2022 but please consult with your recruiter. Seeking US and Canadian students only.

The Role

We are currently seeking a Software Engineer Intern to join our Platform Services Team! The Platform Services team works on backend services that are used across the entire Addepar engineering stack. We write critical, performance sensitive code that the organization depends on when delivering customer-facing applications. As a member of the team you will be within a team of talented engineers and will design, implement, and roll out systems instrumental in Addepar's growth and global expansion.

Engineering is at the core of Addepar and we are looking to add the best, brightest, and most passionate software engineers to our team. If you are excited about doing the best work of your career and you enjoy the rush of shipping high quality code to production every day we're excited to meet you! Our software engineers come from a variety of backgrounds, ranging from Silicon Valley entrepreneurs to finance tech veterans. What they have in common is tremendous talent and dedication to architecting, implementing, and shipping high quality software.

What You'll Do

Build new backend software using the latest technologies in messaging and microservices.
Work with your mentors to build a CI/CD pipeline for your microservices
Release it to production!

Who You Are

Must be currently enrolled in a post-secondary educational institution (university must be located in the US & Canada) & must be returning to school after internship
Available to intern for the full 12 weeks
Extraordinary talent in software engineering. Ability to write high quality object oriented code.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Working knowledge of development best practices and experience working in a team.

General familiarity with some of the technologies we use:
HTTP, REST and web API best practices.
SQL, relational databases and key-value stores.
Specific knowledge of Java is a plus.

About Addepar

Addepar was founded in 2009 by Palantir co-founder Joe Lonsdale, who currently serves as an active Chairman of its Board of Directors and General Partner at 8VC. Addepar works with hundreds of leading financial advisors, family offices and large financial institutions that manage data for over $3 trillion of assets on the company's platform. Addepar was named a Forbes Fintech 50 company and honored as a member of the CB Insights Fintech 250. Addepar is headquartered in Silicon Valley and has offices in New York City, Salt Lake City and Edinburgh, Scotland.

At Addepar, we are driven by our core values:
Take Action - We believe in empowering each other to make decisions that elevate our colleagues and our communities.
Build Together - We celebrate success by recognizing the value of collaborating with each other, our clients and partners.
Best Ideas Win - We welcome new ideas that inspire change.
Demand Transparency - We encourage open discussion and information-sharing to strengthen communication across organizations.
Solve Problems that Matter - We put our community of clients and partners first by creating technology that meets their needs today

In addition to our core values, Addepar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We seek to bring together diverse ideas, experiences, skill sets, perspectives, backgrounds and identities to drive innovative solutions. We commit to promoting a welcoming environment where inclusion and belonging are held as a shared responsibility.

To ensure the health and safety of all Addepeeps and our prospective candidates, we have instituted a virtual interview and onboarding experience.

position: Intern - Software Developer - Summer 2022, MO or Remote
description:
Full Job Description
About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.

The Role

Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.

Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.

The Experience

Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems
Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects
Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization.
Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.
The Main Responsibilities

As a Software Developer in our Strategic Planning and Transformation organization, the Intern will work collaboratively within our Digital Experience teams. The intern will collaborate with the PF/Chi team in building clean and maintainable code. Tasks during the 10 weeks will include writing new components for the Chi design system and extend existing Portal Framework applications with new pages and functionalities that leverage existing, reusable components and API endpoints. You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions and work in a team environment.

Understand the requirements of each task and discuss the approach with more senior members of the team.
Write the required code and tests and validate them locally.
Send pull requests and initiate a discussion about the proposed changes.
Ensure the CICD builds complete successfully so the changes can be merged successfully.
Document the components and/or views properly.
Assist with user experience and design.
What We Look For in a Candidate
Education Requirements
In pursuit of degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, as a rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – June 2023.
Proficiency and understanding of.
Preferred technical skills: experience with JavaScript or TypeScript.
Must-have technical skills: experience with any typical high-level language in the industry, such as Java, JS, Python or Go.
Professional Attributes
Strong drive for results and taking initiative
Ability to be resourceful and adaptable
Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation.
Work Setting
Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Town & Country, MO (St. Louis area) or will consider remote/ work from home.
Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August)
Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations)
US work authorization
What to Expect Next

After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you!

position: Research Intern, Deep Learning for Computer Graphics (PhD)
description:
Full Job Description
Facebook Reality Labs (FRL) focuses on delivering Facebook's vision through Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR). The FRL team is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, speech, virtual assistant, machine learning, mixed reality, graphics, displays, sensors, and new ways to map the human body among many others.

The On-Device AI Research team in FRL brings together a world class team of researchers working on a range of problems in Image/Video processing, 3D Reconstruction and Real-time Graphics using Deep Learning. Our work is at the core of enabling future AR and VR products. We are seeking exceptional interns with a background in Deep Learning for Real Time Graphics to join our team.

For this position, research focus is on novel graphics pipelines that implement algorithms for scene reconstruction, differentiable and inverse rendering, and machine learning-based image synthesis. You will get exposure to the full stack, from algorithms down to how these algorithms map to the target device. You will work with the research mentors to understand the challenges and build state-of-the-art networks to tackle them and then work with the software/hardware team to deploy these solutions on-device. Our internships are twelve (12) or sixteen (16) weeks long.
Research and develop novel Deep Learning based methods in the area of Real Time Graphics for Augmented and Virtual Reality Devices.
Prototype the techniques to achieve state-of-the-art accuracy within the constraints of on-device and real-time execution.
Collaborate with other research scientists and software engineers to develop innovative deep learning techniques for Lightfield Rendering, Spatio-temporal Reconstruction, etc.
Present the outcomes of the research findings as papers in top tier conferences in the area of Computer Graphics.
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics or related field.
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
2+ years experience or equivalent graduate research experience in developing machine learning solutions for Computer Graphics, Neural Rendering, Lightfields, etc.
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op.
Proven track record in publishing papers in machine learning and/or computer vision conferences such as SIGGRAPH, SIGGRAPH-Asia, CVPR, etc.
Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration.

Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Full Job Description
About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.

The Role

Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.
Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology. During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time. Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace.
The Experience
  • Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems
  • Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects
  • Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization.
  • Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.
The Main Responsibilities

As a Security Intern in our North America Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our team to proactively look for threats and intercept them. Tasks during the 10 weeks will include threat-hunting. Security interns will have the potential to learn about cyber incidences, malware technology, point operating systems, and many other security measures. This will give interns the opportunity to think like a hacker in order to better protect Lumen from attacks.

  • Hunt for known IOCs on Lumen infrastructure
  • Research active threats in the wild and then hunt for indicators on Lumen's network
  • Work with CIRT on current threats to Lumen infrastructure
  • Work with Lumen Pen-testers to identify current attacker TTPs that may be seen within Lumen
  • Create reports on findings from all threat hunting
  • Create alerts for CIRT to respond to for active threat techniques
What We Look For in a Candidate

  • Education Requirements
o Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior or master’s level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023.
o Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Data Science, Computer Science, MIS, Cybersecurity, and other related fields
  • Proficiency and understanding of;
o Windows systems
o Corporate Sized Networks
o Malware Technology
o Windows end point operating systems
o Basic trouble shooting computer systems
o Security principles and best practices
o Log review experience is a plus
  • Professional Attributes
o Strong drive for results and taking initiative
o Ability to be inquisitive, critical thinking, and adaptable-
o Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions
o Strong written and verbal communication skills
o Ability to interact with business partners and drive the conversation.
  • Work Setting
o Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Broomfield -CO, or Remote- Work From Home
o Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August)
o Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations)

What to Expect Next

After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position. A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application. For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application. Thank you!

position: Research Intern, Deep Learning based Computational Photography (PhD)
description:
Full Job Description
Facebook Reality Labs focuses on delivering Facebook's vision through Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR). The FRL team is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, speech, virtual assistant, machine learning, mixed reality, graphics, displays, sensors, and new ways to map the human body among many others.

The On-Device AI Research team in FRL brings together a world class team of researchers working on a range of problems in Image/Video processing, 3D Reconstruction and Real-time Graphics using Deep Learning. Our work is at the core of enabling future AR and VR products. We are seeking exceptional interns with a background in Deep Learning based Computational Photography, Image Processing and/or Real Time Graphics to join our team. We are specifically looking for candidates to work in areas such as Neural View Synthesis, AI based Camera ISP, Self-Supervised Image Processing, etc.

In this position, you will get exposure to the full stack, from algorithms down to how these algorithms map to the target device. You will work with the research mentors to understand the challenges and build state-of-the-art networks to tackle them and then work with the software/hardware team to deploy these solutions on-device. Our internships are twelve (12) - sixteen (16) weeks long.
Research and develop novel Deep Learning based methods in the area of Image Processing, Neural View Synthesis and Real Time Graphics.
Prototype the techniques to achieve state-of-the-art accuracy within the constraints of on-device and real-time execution.
Collaborate with other research scientists and software engineers to develop innovative deep learning techniques for vision and/or computational photography use-cases.
Present the outcomes of the research findings as papers in top tier conferences in the area of CV and Graphics.
Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics or related field.
Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment.
2+ years experience or equivalent graduate research experience in developing machine learning solutions for Image and Video Restoration, Computational Photography, Neural View Synthesis, etc.
Programming experience in Python and hands-on experience with frameworks such as PyTorch.
Intent to return to degree-program after the completion of the internship/co-op.
Proven track record in publishing papers in machine learning and/or computer vision conferences including CVPR, ICCV, ICRA, ISMAR, ECCV, NeurIPS, AAAI, ICLR, TVCG, SIGGRAPH.
Interpersonal experience: cross-group and cross-culture collaboration

Samsung SoC R&D Lab in San Diego is seeking talented, highly motivated individuals to join our team for NPU SW developments. In this team, you will work on the deep learning compiler development and optimizations that can significantly enhance the ability of Samsung mobile products and platforms.

LLVM experience is big plus but not mandatory
Python skill is a plus

description:
Full Job Description
Company Description

As the world’s leader in digital payments technology, Visa’s mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

Accelerate delivery of Visa’s acceptance solutions

Full Job Description
Achronix Semiconductor Corporation is a fabless semiconductor corporation based in Santa Clara, California, offering high-performance FPGA solutions. Achronix is the only supplier to have both high-performance and high-density standalone FPGAs and embedded FPGA (eFPGA) solutions in high-volume production. Achronix's FPGA and eFPGA IP offerings are further enhanced by ready-to-use PCIe accelerator cards targeting AI, ML, networking and data center applications. All of Achronix's products are supported by best-in-class EDA software tools.

Position Profile Name:
Staff Software Engineer Intern

Requisition No.:Internship

Type of Position:Regular, Exempt

Reports to:Sr. Principal Engineer

Location:Santa Clara, California

Contact:hr@achronix.com

Job Description/Responsibilities

You will invent, devise, and implement robust Software solutions for routing of large Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs), leveraging unique features of the Achronix FPGA technology. you will utilize your knowledge of Electronic Design Automation (EDA) algorithms in the context of a high-performance timing-driven FPGA routing and placement, and will make significant contributions to the Achronix CAD Environment (ACE) EDA software tool chain.

Primary Job Responsibilities

You will be primarily responsible for inventing, designing and implementing novel FPGA routing algorithms in the Achronix CAD Environment (ACE) Software tool chain. The candidate will be an expert in the area of VLSI routing algorithms, and will utilize your knowledge of EDA algorithms such as A*/Pathfinder/Dijkstra’s shortest path, to implement fast, timing-driven FPGA routing solutions in ACE. You will have a unique opportunity to collaborate directly with other Achronix Research and Development (RnD) Software team members working on detailed routing, global routing, detailed placement, global placement, running analysis, runtime and memory optimizations, and continuously improve the quality of results.

Required Skills
At least 4 years of university/industrial software development experience in RnD of EDA software
Excellent programming and debugging skills, and proficiency in C++ programming language
Expert understanding of EDA Software data structures and algorithms, specially Very Large Scale Integrated (VLSI) circuit routing in the context of FPGAs
Strong analytical skills to understand cause and effect in a large Software code base
Solid understanding of EDA placement and routing algorithms, preferable for FPGAs
Ability and willingness to try novel approaches to engineering problem solving
Good programming and debugging skills
Proficient in Java/Eclipse and an expert in C++
Preferred Skills
Familiarity with Linux Operating System and Verilog and/or VHDL Hardware design languages
Familiarity with Software Multi-threading techniques
Good understanding of digital circuits
Knowledge of scripting languages, especially TCL and Python
Experience with EDA Tools such as those from Xilinx, Synopsys, Magma, etc.
Education and Experience
MS in Engineering (Computer Science, Electrical/Computer or other related/applied Engineering) from a top research university with at least 2 years of industrial experience in EDA software development using C++
Ph.D. with original dissertation in EDA Software research and development from a top research university, preferred

position: Software Engineer, Machine Learning Software Stack Intern
description:
Full Job Description
Achronix Semiconductor Corporation is a fabless semiconductor corporation based in Santa Clara, California, offering high-performance FPGA solutions. Achronix is the only supplier to have both high-performance and high-density standalone FPGAs and embedded FPGA (eFPGA) solutions in high-volume production. Achronix's FPGA and eFPGA IP offerings are further enhanced by ready-to-use PCIe accelerator cards targeting AI, ML, networking and data center applications. All of Achronix's products are supported by best-in-class EDA software tools.

Position Profile Name:Software Engineer, Machine Learning Software Stack Intern

Requisition No.:Internship

Type of Position:Regular, Exempt

Reports to:Sr. Principal Engineer

Location:Santa Clara, California

Contact:hr@achronix.com

Job Description

At Achronix Semiconductor we develop FPGA-based hardware, software, and systems solutions to accelerate critical applications in areas such at 5G wireless infrastructure, network switching, and datacenter services. We work in small highly motivated teams of domain experts across the full product range, from high-level systems software to digital and analog circuit design, creating innovative products that are first-to-market and solve critical business needs.

You will drive the effort to develop a complete software stack for an FPGA-based machine learning inference accelerator card reference platform. You will adapt existing open-source and university software when possible, and develop new software from scratch as needed, to assemble a complete, full-stack, end-to-end software solution. You will work closely with sales, marketing, systems engineering, EDA tool developers, and FPGA architects to support diverse use models from FPGA micro-architecture exploration, memory subsystem design optimization, place-and-route software verification, system prototyping, pre-sales demonstration development, and customer deployment and scaling.

Prior experience is required working with a machine learning accelerator micro-architecture and ISA, as well as current knowledge of state-of-the-art research. You must have a background in open-source compiler hacking. Experience desired with compiler intermediate representations (IRs) and back-ends, JIT compilers, as well as kernel-mode and user-mode runtime environments and device drivers. Familiarity is desired with industry-standard machine learning frameworks, acceleration libraries, domain-specific languages, and with common DNN models.

Required Skills
Two years of work or educational experience in machine leaning accelerator micro-architectures and compilers
Skilled practitioner in C++ or Java
Experience in Python, Verilog, and System-C

Experience required in one of more of the following:
Machine learning accelerators such as OpenTPU, NVDLA, VTA, EIC
Compilers such as Glow, TVM, CLANG, LLVM, or GCC
Machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe2, and Keras
Acceleration libraries such as MXNet
Domain-specific languages such as Halide and Spatial
Common DNN models such as AlexNet, ResNet50, Inception, YOLO, RNN, and LSTM
Embedded system runtime environments and device drivers
Education and Experience
BS, MS, or PhD in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Applied Math, or Physics

Achronix's FPGA and eFPGA IP offerings are further enhanced by ready-to-use PCIe accelerator cards targeting AI, ML, networking and data center applications. All of Achronix's products are supported by best-in-class EDA software tools.

Position Profile Name:Senior FPGA Software Engineer Intern – EDA

Requisition No.:Internship

Type of Position:Regular, Exempt

Reports to:Sr. Principal Engineer

Location:Santa Clara, California

Contact:hr@achronix.com

Job Description

You will research, invent, and implement robust software solutions for placement, routing and timing optimization of Speedster7t large standalone FPGAs and Speedcore embedded FPGAs (eFPGAs), while leveraging unique features of the Achronix FPGA technology. You will utilize your knowledge of EDA algorithms and data structures in the context of a high-performance timing-driven FPGA placement and routing application, to make significant contributions to the ACE software tool chain. You will have a unique opportunity to collaborate directly with other Achronix research and development (RnD) software team members working on synthesis, detailed routing, global routing, detailed placement, global placement, timing optimization, runtime analysis, and runtime and memory optimizations. You will contribute to a culture of agile innovation and continuous quality improvement.

Required Skills
At least four years of university and/or industrial software development experience in RnD of EDA software
Excellent programming and debugging skills, and expertise in the C++ programming language
Deep and broad understanding of software data structures and algorithms, specifically VLSI circuit placement, routing, and optimization
Strong analytical skills to understand cause and effect in a large software code base
Ability and willingness to try novel approaches to solve difficult software engineering problems
Preferred Skills
Experience with the use of one or more commercial or academic EDA tools
Familiarity with both Linux and Microsoft Windows operating systems, compilers, and IDEs
Experience with cross-platform development is a plus
Familiarity with digital design concepts and hardware description languages (HDLs) such as SystemVerilog, Verilog, or VHDL
Knowledge of scripting languages, especially Python, Tcl, Perl, and shell scripting
Good understanding of digital circuits with prior experience in FPGA technologies is a plus
Experience with version control systems such as Perforce, Git, or Mercurial
Familiarity with software multi-threading techniques is a plus
Education and Experience
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or other related/applied engineering degree from a top research university, in addition to some prior years of industrial experience in EDA software development using C++
Ph.D. with original dissertation in EDA software RnD from a top research university

Facebook was built to help people connect and share, and over the last decade our tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate with one another. With over a billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at Facebook offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization. Facebook is seeking Research Interns to join Facebook AI Research (FAIR). We are committed to advancing the field of artificial intelligence by making fundamental advances in technologies to help interact with and understand our world. We are seeking individuals passionate in areas such as deep learning, computer vision, audio and speech processing, natural language processing, machine learning, reinforcement learning, computational statistics, and applied mathematics. Our interns have an opportunity to make core algorithmic advances and apply their ideas at an unprecedented scale. Many of our interns publish at top tier conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, and ACL. This internship has a minimum 12-week duration. We have openings in our Menlo Park, New York, Seattle, and Pittsburgh offices. Internships will be awarded on a rolling basis and candidates are encouraged to apply early. GDIT QUEST – Summer 2022 Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence Internship

Do you have a passion to lean in and make an impact? Does embracing autonomy and seizing opportunity excite you? Are you ready to gain real-life experience alongside the leaders helping to deliver the technology, solutions, and talent essential to the future of the country? If your answer is yes to all three questions, then an internship at GDIT may be just right for you!

At GDIT, our people are our business. We pride ourselves on the work our innovators do to support and secure some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the world. We wouldn’t be successful without our ability to attract new talent to join our team.

What sets a GDIT internship apart from other organizations in the industry?

GDIT’s QUEST Summer Internship Program is designed with you in mind! Our internship provides you the opportunity to be a part of a collaborative team that is helping to solve our clients’ most challenging matters. Throughout GDIT’s 10-week QUEST Summer Internship Program, you will work side-by-side on an assignment with a GDIT professional delivering work for internal or external clients. You’ll be assigned to a team of QUEST peers to research and propose solutions to a current business challenge. You’ll participate in a mentoring circle led by an early career champion, and you’ll have the opportunity to interact with GDIT leaders. You’ll have professional development opportunities, soft skills and tech skills training, and lots of fun!

Throughout the internship, you will be supported by your manager, mentor and your recruiter to ensure you receive regular feedback on your work and help navigate the company.

How You’ll Make this Internship Opportunity Your Own

Our Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence summer interns will work on a range of projects that ideally align with their interests. Some interns will use statistical techniques to provide insights into internal or external customer data to guide decision-making and enhance user experience. Other interns will build machine learning algorithms or work on artificial intelligence system deployments. The ideal intern will have knowledge of computer languages and their applications to enable a system to perform specific functions.

The Must-Haves

Currently enrolled in an associates, bachelors or masters degree program in computer science, IT, engineering, or other STEM field from a United States-based college or university or high school (must be over the age of 16)

Must have US Citizenship

Basic understanding of Microsoft Office products (e.g., Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Excel, and Teams)

What You’ll Need to Deliver Your Best Every Day

Problem solving and interest in big data

Interest in data transformation, model selection, cross-validation, and deployment

Interest or experience with big data platform tools

Knowledge of statistical techniques

Knowledge of Python or other programming languages

Experience working in a collaborative team environment

Intuitiveness with an ability to identify and solve complex problems related to rapidly changing technology

Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions

GDIT QUEST internships are paid and full-time (40 hours/week) for 10 consecutive weeks with starting on June 6, 2022. Applicants should have a minimum of one semester remaining in their studies after their internship concludes.

Through GDIT QUEST we are developing the next generation of GDIT technologists and professionals and equipping students with best-in-class skills to take back to the classroom! Take the first step in your QUEST and apply today!

Note: We receive a high volume of applications and review them on a rolling basis. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Our goal is to follow up with you within two weeks of your application.

For more than 35 years, Viasat has helped shape how consumers, businesses, governments and militaries around the globe communicate. We’re looking for people who think big, act fearlessly, and create an inclusive environment that drives positive impact to join our team.

Job Responsibilities

The Virtual Networking team develops multiple products critical for Viasat ground system to traverse the traffic across data centers which could be public or private clouds. As an intern, you will be supporting the network controller, which is a Viasat tailored SDN controller that dynamically steers the traffic based on the customer profile, congestion in the network, or provides redundancy in case of failures. The network controller allows the user to dynamically choose the added valued services like firewall, parental control, etc. as part of their Viasat Subscription Plan. You'll be working on the network controller component to measure the latency introduced as packets steer through different services. You'll be using Golang, OVS, Graph topology, and other sophisticated computer algorithms and distributed software technologies.

Our team uses state-of-art technologies including, but is not limited to, Golang, Python, NodeJs, machine learning, LSTM model, AWS cloud technology, and highly distributed architecture.

Requirements

Preferences
